titleStmt.title: To ARTHUR RYLAND,Arthur Ryland (1807-77), solicitor: see Pilgrim Letters 4, p. 29n. Founder of the Birmingham and Midland Institute in 1853. 25 MAY 1854

sourceDesc.p: Text from facsimile in John Wilson Manuscripts Ltd. catalogue, 2003.

body.p: I have gone over the listA list of people to ask to give readings or lectures in aid of the Institute (above) compiled by the Canvassing Committee; Bulwer Lytton was among those applied to: see Vol. VII, p. 478 and n. with great interest, I assure you, and am extremely glad to have the pleasure of hearing from you again.
Mrs. Dickens and her sister unite in kindest regards.

closer.salute: Always My Dear Sir,Very faithfully Yours
